question: There are severe social consequences to housing shortages in cities and only the government can solve these problems.To what extent do you agree or disagree?
text: Nowadays, Individuals face problems regarding the shortage of living space in the cities, and there are many social reasons for this phenomenon. At the same time, some consider that higher authorities can tackle these issues. I am totally in favour of this statement, and this essay will analyse the reasons for this viewpoint in the following paragraphs with a reasonable conclusion.

To commence with that, they have the power to make any changes in the city, and people give votes for them to make their life easier. To explain it more, if individuals or any private companies try to provide more living accommodations by constructing multi-story buildings, they have to get permission from the government, which is an arduous and time-consuming process. However, the government can solve this by shifting the factories to open areas, creating more space for citizens. So this is the responsibility of the ruling power of cities.
